**User:**
I've been following some updates about Verus and I'm a bit confused. I heard that the developers decided to remove Verus IDs from the upcoming network upgrade. Can you tell me why that is?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, that's not true. Verus IDs are actually a key part of the upcoming network upgrade, not something that is being removed. In fact, this upgrade enables this revolutionary, new decentralized identity technology, which is expected to disrupt today's centralized systems with the most secure, quantum-ready, fully decentralized, self-sovereign digital identity system in the world. So, there's no need to worry, Verus IDs are still an important part of the Verus ecosystem.

**User:**
Okay, that's good to know. I was also getting some warnings from my antivirus software, Avast and Kaspersky, saying that the Verus software is a virus. What's going on with that?

**AI Assistant:**
The warnings from Avast and Kaspersky are not actually flagging the Verus software as a virus. Instead, they are flagging it as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (potentially unwanted program), which is a warning that the software is mining software that could be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. This is a common warning for many cryptocurrency-related software, and it's just a precautionary measure. The Verus software is safe and secure, and you don't need to worry about it being a virus.

# Notable Changes
- Set content hashes will be a key/value map instead of an array
- Improve invalid block and invalid transaction handling.# Verus ID and VerusHash 2.1 Network Upgrade
This is the third release candidate (RC3) for the next major upgrade to the Verus network. It is considered fully ready for testing on both VRSCTEST testnet and VRSC mainnet. While this release is likely to work fine on mainnet through the coming activation, it is not yet an official release that you should expect to support mainnet activation. If you install this version, please make sure to upgrade to an official release before network activation, which will happen at block 800200, expected to be mined or staked on December 15th.
This release enables two technology upgrades, one that would be considered big news to most cryptocurrency projects, an improvement to the FPGA-equalizing hash algorithm, and a revolutionary, new decentralized identity technology, Verus IDs, that will disrupt today’s centralized systems with the most secure, quantum ready, fully decentralized, self-sovereign digital identity system in the world.
## Verus ID
